scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of PAdES is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
ISO has defined a clear procedure to develop its standards. It consists in a 6-steps process where everyone who is interested can participate. However, if you want to participate, you have to contact your national standards body and you have to be approved for joining the Technical committee (TC) who will develop the standard. ISO has defined the roadmap of standards, it is composed of 6 steps as before said. For the approval of a standard the two-thirds majority of P-members of TC is needed. If the result is negative, the document is returned to TC/SC to be further studied. 

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
As defined on the TC standardisation, only TC members are involved in the development of ISO standards. A review is carried out to arrange the consensus firstly within the TC members and subsequently is reviewed by the different ISO member bodies. However, it cannot be considered a public review, because only TC members can participate.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. statement:
The ISO 14533-3:2017 which refers to PAdES is not available for free for everyone to study. Payment is needed to reach access to the standard.

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
There are no disclosures of ISO IPR Database to identify the licensing under the specification. ISO 14533-3:2017 (PAdES) is not listed in ISO/IEC/ITU Common Patent policy, so it cannot be confirmed that the specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.

ISO patents:
https://www.iso.org/iso-standards-and-patents.html

ISO standards and patents IPR database:
http://isotc.iso.org/livelink/livelink/13622347/Patents_database.xls?func=doc.Fetch&nodeId=13622347

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The term of PAdES was first introduced in 2009 as PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures (PAdES) on ETSI Technical specifications. The specification has got some updates and the latest version is 1.2.1, it was published in 2010. So, it is mature enough for its use in the development of products and services.

ETSI TS 101 733 V1.6.3 (2009-07):
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
PAdES has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products. In the following link there is an example of integrating digital signatures like PAdES in a framework.

Digital signature service:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/DSS/webapp-demo/doc/dss-documentation.html

criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, PAdES is recommended by the European Union as an eSignature standard to ensure that electronic signatures can be created and validated anywhere in Europe. So, PAdES can be considered as an asset to build innovative solutions.

eSignature standards:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eSignature+standards

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

statement:
PAdES is a business domain agnostic specification that can be reused in a cross-domain way. It can apply to any type of transaction, between an individual and a company, between two companies, between an individual and a governmental body, etc.

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/electronic-signatures-and-infrastructures-esi-pdf-advanced-electronic-signature-formats-pades-part-2

criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
PAdES is independent of any technology or platform. Moreover, it is independent of any environment, so it can be applied to any environment, for example, smart cards, GSM SIM cards, special programs for electronic signatures, etc. 

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The purpose of PAdES is to foster the use of electronic signature. Therefore, it is clear that it reduces the administrative burden by making signing possible electronically.

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
PAdES is a set of restrictions and extensions to PDF and ISO 32000-1 making it suitable for advanced electronic signatures. One profile of PAdES is PAdES-LTV (Long Term Validation), it is a signature conformant which has one or more long-term-validation attributes that guarantee the preservation of the authenticity of the signature.

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the PAdES in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, it can define the interoperability aspects of the "e-Seal Preservation Service" and "e-Signature Preservation Service" ABBs of the EIRA Technical Infrastructure View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are many free online tools that perform numerous checking processes in order to verify the conformity of the ETSI Advanced Electronic Signatures which include PAdES.

PAdES conformance testing:
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/index.shtml

statement:
PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
After searching in the different official European websites, there is no evidence of any cross-border project that uses PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) nor explicit agreements involving the usage of the specification. However, the specification PAdES from ETSI, is involved in some cross-border projects as "Analysis of standards related to Trust Service Providers" developed by ENISA (European Union Agency for Network and Information Security) which is a centre of network and information security expertise for the EU, its member states, the private sector and Europe’s citizens. 

ENISA project:
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/tsp_standards_2015/at_download/fullReport

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
There are no Member States recommending PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) in their ICT National Catalogues.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of PAdES (ISO 14533-3:2017) within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of PAdES is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of PAdES is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
PAdES does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but defines an electronic signature format using PDF. 

PAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/67937.html

PAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102700_102799/10277801/01.01.01_60/ts_10277801v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of PAdES is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.
